page.title: 11VILLAGE LIFE, K.UNDERWOOD
page.content:
The most notable village event in Kirkby Underwood is the Annual Garden Fete and Clay Shoot in June, arranged by the P.C.C.,to raise money to pay the church quota. There are many stalls and competitions on which to spend freely, including the coconut shy, bowling, beanbag throwing and rifle range. Â£935 was raised in 1985.
The present Village Hall is housed in the former primary school, closed in 1971 and bought by the village in 1973. The Hall is run by an annually elected committee of villagers and funded by generous donations and fund- raising events when necessary.
The two main users of the Hall are the Parish Council, which meets four times a year, and the Women's Institute which meets Tuesday evenings monthly.
